verses.text: 撒種的比喻那一天，耶穌從房子裡出來，坐在海邊。

words.note: Lit. 'comparison parable'.
Used as a directional complement after a verb.

verses.text: 有很多人聚集到他那裡。於是，他上船坐下來，眾人都站在岸上。

words.note: Verb-object compound.
Verb-complement compound.
Often used in religious or formal contexts.

verses.text: 他用比喻對眾人講了許多事，說：「有一個撒種的出去撒種。

words.note: Lit. 'comparison parable'.
Often used in religious or formal contexts.
Lit. 'one who sows seeds'.
Verb-complement compound.

verses.text: 撒的時候，有的落在路旁，小鳥飛來就吃掉了。

words.note: Verb-complement compound.
Verb-complement compound.

verses.text: 有的落在泥土不多的石地上，因為泥土不深，很快就長起來。

words.note: Verb-complement compound.

verses.text: 但太陽一出來，就把它曬乾，又因為沒有根就枯萎了。

words.note: Often combined with 就 to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 有的落在荊棘裡，荊棘長大了，就把它擠住。

words.note: Postposition indicating 'in' or 'inside'.
住 as a resultative complement implies holding or fixing in place.

verses.text: 有的落在好土裡，結出果實，有一百倍的，有六十倍的，有三十倍的。

words.note: Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those of 100 fold'.

verses.text: 有耳的，就應當聽。」

words.note: Common biblical phrase, 'He who has ears...'
Turns the verb phrase 'have ears' into 'those who have ears'.

verses.text: 用比喻的目的門徒上前問耶穌：「你對他們講話，為甚麼用比喻呢？」

words.note: Used at the end of a question or statement to soften it.

verses.text: 他回答：「天國的奧祕，只給你們知道，卻不給他們知道。
因為凡是有的，還要給他，他就充足有餘；凡是沒有的，就連他有甚麼也要拿去。
因此，我用比喻對他們講話，因為他們看卻看不見，聽也聽不到，也不明白。

words.note: 看不見 (kàn bu jiàn) means 'cannot see'.
聽不到 (tīng bu dào) means 'cannot hear'.

verses.text: 以賽亞的預言，正應驗在他們身上，他說：『你們聽是聽見了，總是不明白；看是看見了，總是不領悟。
因為這人民的心思遲鈍，用不靈的耳朵去聽，又閉上了眼睛；免得自己眼睛看見，耳朵聽見，心裡明白，回轉過來，我就醫好他們。』

words.note: Here implies 'unresponsive' or 'dull'.
Directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker, or completion of action.

verses.text: 「你們的眼睛是有福的，因為可以看見；你們的耳朵是有福的，因為可以聽見。

words.note: Lit. 'have blessings'
Used to form an adjectival phrase

words.definition: can, may, to be able to

words.note: Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'
Lit. 'have blessings'
Used to form an adjectival phrase

words.definition: can, may, to be able to

words.note: Resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'perceive'

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，曾經有許多先知和義人想看你們所看見的，卻沒有看到，想聽你們所聽見的，卻沒有聽到。

words.note: Indicates a past experience
Lit. 'one who knows first'

words.definition: to want, to think, to wish

words.note: Used before verbs to form a noun phrase 'that which is V-ed'
Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'perceive'
Negates past actions or possession
Resultative verb compound: 'look' + 'achieve seeing'

words.definition: to want, to think, to wish

words.note: Used before verbs to form a noun phrase 'that which is V-ed'
Resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'perceive'
Negates past actions or possession
Resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'achieve hearing'

verses.text: 解釋撒種的比喻「所以你們要聽這撒種人的比喻。

words.note: Verb-object compound
Common term for parables in the Bible.

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Lit. 'seed-sowing person'
Common term for parables in the Bible.

verses.text: 凡是聽了天國的道卻不明白的，那惡者就來把撒在他心中的奪去。這就是撒在路旁的。

words.note: Often used with 都 (dōu) to mean 'whoever/whatever... all'
A key concept in Matthew's Gospel
Often refers to God's word or teaching in a religious context.
Often refers to Satan in the Bible.
Introduces object of a verb, indicating it is 'disposed of'
Figurative for innermost thoughts/feelings
Resultative verb compound: 'snatch' + 'away'

verses.text: 那撒在石地上的，就是人聽了道，立刻歡歡喜喜地接受，

words.note: Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on the surface of'.
Often refers to God's word or teaching in a religious context.
Reduplicated form for emphasis, 'joyfully and happily'.
Links an adjective/adverbial phrase to a verb

verses.text: 可是他裡面沒有根，只是暫時的；一旦為道遭遇患難，受到迫害，就立刻跌倒了。

words.note: Refers to God's word or message.
Contextually means to apostatize or lose faith.

verses.text: 那撒在荊棘裡的，就是人聽了道，有今世的憂慮和財富的迷惑把道擠住，結不出果實來。

words.note: Refers to the location among thorns.
Refers to God's word or message.
Often implies the secular or temporary world.
Often refers to spiritual or worldly anxieties in biblical context.
Often refers to spiritual delusion or worldly enticement.
Refers to God's word or message.
Refers to plants being choked by weeds.
A V-neg-C structure meaning unable to produce.

verses.text: 那撒在好土裡的，就是人聽了道，又明白了，結出果實來，有一百倍的，有六十倍的，有三十倍的。」

words.note: Refers to the location in good soil.
Refers to God's word or message.

verses.text: 稗子的比喻耶穌對他們另外講了一個比喻，說：「天國好像人把好的種子撒在田裡。

words.note: Refers to a type of weed resembling wheat, often translated as tares.
Refers to God's spiritual realm or sovereignty.
Refers to the location in the field.

verses.text: 人們睡了的時候，他的仇敵來把稗子撒在麥子中間，就走了。

words.note: Used to form a temporal clause '...的時候' (when...)
Refers to a type of weed resembling wheat, often translated as tares.

verses.text: 到了發苗吐穗的時候，稗子也顯出來。

words.note: Refers to darnel, a weed that resembles wheat.

verses.text: 僕人都前來問家主：『主人，你不是把好的種子撒在田裡嗎？那些稗子是從哪裡來的呢？』

words.note: Used to ask a rhetorical question expecting agreement.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 他回答：『這是仇敵所作的。』僕人問他：『你要我們去拔掉它嗎？』

words.note: Indicates a passive or nominalized action; 'that which is done by'.

verses.text: 他說：『不用，因為拔稗子的時候，恐怕也把麥子連根拔出來。
收割之前，讓它們一同生長。到了收割的時候，我會吩咐收割的工人先拔掉稗子，捆起來，留著焚燒，卻要把麥子收進我的倉裡。』」
芥菜種和麵酵的比喻耶穌又對他們講了另外一個比喻，說：「天國好像一粒芥菜種，人拿去把它種在田裡。

words.note: Indicates direct object is placed before the verb.

verses.text: 它是種子中最小的，但長大了，卻比其他的蔬菜都大，成為一棵樹，甚至天空的飛鳥也來在它的枝頭搭窩。」
他對他們講了另一個比喻：「天國好像麵酵，婦女拿去放在三斗麵裡，直到全團發起來。」

words.note: 斗 (dǒu) is an ancient unit of dry measure, about 10 liters.

verses.text: 解釋稗子的比喻耶穌用比喻向群眾講了這一切，他所講的，沒有不用比喻的。

words.note: Indicates the agent or subject of an action, forming a nominalizer.
Forms a nominal phrase with the preceding verb/clause.
Used to nominalize the preceding phrase '不用比喻'.

verses.text: 這就應驗了先知所說的：「我要開口用比喻，把創世以來隱祕的事說出來。」

words.note: Indicates the agent or subject of an action, forming a nominalizer.
Forms a nominal phrase with the preceding verb/clause.
Indicates direct object is placed before the verb.

verses.text: 耶穌離開群眾，進到屋裡，門徒前來問他：「請你給我們解釋田裡稗子的比喻。」

words.note: Lit. 'door student', follower of a teaching.
Used after nouns to indicate location.
A weed resembling wheat, often translated as 'tares' in biblical context.

verses.text: 他回答：「那撒好種子的是人子，

words.note: Nominalizes the preceding phrase, e.g., 'the one who sows'.
A title Jesus used for himself.

verses.text: 田就是世界，好種子就是屬天國的人，稗子就是屬那惡者的人，

words.note: Emphasizes a logical consequence or identification.
Emphasizes a logical consequence or identification.
Refers to God's reign and realm.
A weed resembling wheat, often translated as 'tares' in biblical context.
Emphasizes a logical consequence or identification.
Refers to Satan or the devil.

verses.text: 撒稗子的仇敵是魔鬼，收割的時候是這世代的終結，收割的工人是天使。

words.note: A weed resembling wheat, often translated as 'tares' in biblical context.
Links 'sow tares' to 'enemy' as 'the enemy who sows tares'.
Satan, the prince of demons.
Refers to a specific period or era, often 'this present age'.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 稗子怎樣被拔掉用火焚燒，在這世代終結的時候，也是一樣。

words.note: A weed resembling wheat, often translated as 'tares' in biblical context.
Indicates a passive voice construction.
Refers to a specific period or era, often 'this present age'.

verses.text: 那時，人子要差派他的使者，把一切使人犯罪的事和不法之徒，從他的國中拔掉，

words.note: A title for Jesus, emphasizing his humanity and messianic role.
Often refers to angels in biblical context.
Literally 'those of lawlessness'.

verses.text: 丟進火爐，在那裡必要哀哭切齒。

words.note: A common biblical idiom for intense suffering and despair.

verses.text: 那時，義人在他們父的國中，要像太陽一樣的照耀。有耳的，就應當聽。

words.note: A common phrase in the Gospels, urging listeners to pay attention.

verses.text: 其他的比喻「天國好像藏在田裡的寶貝，有人發現了，就把它藏起來，高高興興地離去，變賣了他的一切，來買那田地。

words.note: A central theme in Matthew's Gospel.
Reduplication '高高興興' emphasizes 'very happy'.

verses.text: 「天國好像一個商人，搜羅寶貴的珍珠。

words.note: A central theme in Matthew's Gospel.

verses.text: 他發現了一顆極貴重的珍珠，就離去，變賣了他的一切，來買那顆珍珠。
「天國又好像一個網，撒在海裡，網到各樣的魚。

words.note: Refers to God's reign and spiritual domain.

verses.text: 網滿了之後，人就把網拉上岸，坐下來把好的揀出，收藏起來，不好的就丟在外面。

words.note: A directional complement, indicating downward movement and completion.
A directional complement here, indicating a gathering or putting away.

verses.text: 這世代終結的時候，也是一樣。那時天使要出去，把惡人從義人中分別出來。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to refer to a specific epoch or time.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
A directional complement, indicating outward movement.
A directional complement, indicating appearance or emergence.

verses.text: 丟進火爐，在那裡必要哀哭切齒。

words.note: Often paired with 哀哭 in the Bible to describe extreme suffering.

verses.text: 「這一切你們明白嗎？」他們回答：「明白。」
耶穌說：「所以，每一個作天國門徒的經學家，就像家主從寶庫中拿出新和舊的東西來。」

words.note: Refers to God's reign and spiritual kingdom.
Often refers to students of a master or followers of a religion.
Often refers to Jewish scholars of the Torah.
Lit. 'east-west', a general term for 'things'.
Indicates direction towards speaker or purpose.

verses.text: 耶穌在本鄉遭人厭棄耶穌講完了這些比喻，就離開那地方。
他回到自己的家鄉，在會堂裡教導人，眾人都驚奇，說：「這個人的智慧和能力是從哪裡來的呢？

words.note: Used with 從...來 to emphasize origin.

verses.text: 他不是木匠的兒子嗎？他母親不是馬利亞，他弟弟不是雅各、約瑟、西門和猶大嗎？
他妹妹不是都在我們這裡嗎？他這一切是從哪裡來的呢？」

words.note: Reduplication for intimacy or plurality.
Indicates emphasis on time, place, or manner of an action.

verses.text: 他們就厭棄耶穌。耶穌對他們說：「先知除了在本鄉本家之外，沒有不受人尊敬的。」

words.note: Here, '的' nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'one who...'

verses.text: 因為他們不信，他就不在那裡多行神蹟了。

words.note: Lit. 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.
Indicates a new situation or completion of an action.
